page.syntax: List as C = process_list([L sorted [,C delimiter [,C computer ]]])

argument.name: List
argument.description: A list of processes running on a computer.

argument.name: sorted
argument.description: Optional. Default = .T. Indicates whether or not to sort the list alphabetically.

argument.name: delimiter
argument.description: Optional. Default = CR-LF. The separator to place between entries in the list.

argument.name: computer
argument.description: Optional. Default = "". The computer for which to show the process list.

page.description: use WMI to return a list of Windows processes
page.discussion: The PROCESS_LIST() function returns a list of processes running on a computer. If Computer is blank or ".", then the processes running on the local system are shown. If a different computer name is specified, the list of processes on that remote computer is shown, provided that the user has administrative privileges on the remote computer and a network connection is available. Limitations: Desktop applications only.
page.example:
? process_list() = AcroTray.exe alg.exe alpha5.exe ApacheMonitor.exe cmd.exe csrss.exe csrss.exe ...
? process_list(.t., crlf() , "doc") = acrotray.exe alg.exe csrss.exe ctfmon.exe explorer.exe explorer.exe firefox.exe ...
